text: Saleh Abazari (, born 3 March 1998) is an Iranian karateka. At the 2018 Asian Karate Championships held in Amman, Jordan he won the gold medal in the men's kumite +84 event. Iran also won the gold medal in the men's team kumite event. Iran repeated this the following year in the men's team kumite event at the 2019 Asian Karate Championships held in Tashkent, Uzbekistan. In 2018, he was part of the Iranian team that won the gold medal in the men's team kumite event at the 2018 World Karate Championships held in Madrid, Spain. == Achievements == {| class="wikitable sortable" width=45% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Venue !!Rank !!Event |- |rowspan=3 | 2018 |rowspan=2 | Asian Championships |rowspan=2 | Amman, Jordan |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Kumite +84 kg |- |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Team kumite |- |World Championships |Madrid, Spain |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Team kumite |- |2019 |Asian Championships |Tashkent, Uzbekistan |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Team kumite |} == References == Category:Living people Category:1998 births Category:People from Arak, Iran Category:Iranian male karateka
title: Saleh Abazari
